intro: Amblyorhinum angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant has small, narrow leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration, a key adaptation to its harsh habitat. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences, which help attract pollinators. Amblyorhinum angustifolium is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils, where it plays a role in stabilizing dunes and preventing erosion.
